alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Hamilton, western Echols and southwestern Clinch Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Statenville to near Lake Park to 14 miles west of Madison. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Jennings, Statenville, Blue Springs and Crossroads. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.
